intro: Callista macraei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Callista macraei is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
